common_issues.title: Pieces OS and Desktop App Issues
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing issues with Pieces OS and the Desktop app, including white screens, connection problems, and crashes. Proposed solutions include reinstalling the latest versions, checking for updates, and live troubleshooting with the developers. The root causes are still being investigated for some issues.

related_issues.title: White screen on Windows 11
related_issues.text:
White screen on Windows 11
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

9.0.6

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Installed it yesterday and it was fine until it's a permanently blank screen today when I launch the Pieces Desktop app.

I reinstalled the entire suite multiple times and it's still the same.

![image](https://github.com/pieces-app/support/assets/33184869/bfba2d65-0393-4ef6-b8f9-dc958201fe5d)

## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

### Key Points:

* Users reported seeing a white screen when launching the Pieces Desktop App.
* The white screen was identified as the app window itself, not the background.
* The problem persisted for multiple users, including `jiaweing` and `ubranch`.
* `ubranch` shared a screenshot of the white screen issue.
* `JeffreyMJohnson` reported the same issue and shared screenshots.
* `mack-at-pieces` suggested reinstalling the latest version of the app (3.1.0) and offered to troubleshoot the issue live.

### Problems Identified:

* The Pieces Desktop App displays a white screen upon launch for some users.
* The issue persisted even after reinstalling the app.

### Solutions Proposed/Implemented:

* Reinstalling the latest version of the app (3.1.0).
* Live troubleshooting with the developer.

### Current Status/Outcome:

* The issue is still ongoing for some users, including `ubranch` and `JeffreyMJohnson`.
* The developer is offering time slots for live troubleshooting.
* It is unclear if the proposed solutions have resolved the problem for all users.

### Additional Information:

* There was a discussion on the Flutter stack being unsuitable for Windows tools. However, it is unclear whether this is related to the white screen issue.

**Author:** rosie-at-pieces

**Date:** 2024-11-14

**Key Points:**

**Problems Identified:**

* The root cause of the crash is unknown.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* rosie-at-pieces requested Ganesh-2-4 to send the application logs for troubleshooting.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue is currently being investigated by the Pieces support team.
* No resolution has been provided yet.

**Additional Notes:**

* The issue was reported on November 14, 2024.
* The conversation only includes one message from rosie-at-pieces.

related_issues.title: Pieces OS apparently stuck - VS extension not working
related_issues.text:
Pieces OS apparently stuck - VS extension not working
### Software

Pieces OS, Visual Studio

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

10.1.14.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Hi, I have just installed Pieces on my Windows 11 laptop and I'm experiencing some problems, specifically with Pieces OS and the Visual Studio extension.
Somehow, the desktop app works fine.

Pieces OS seems stuck in the system tray. Every time I click it, a "Sentry Error Event" appears in the log file and the application doesn't do anything.
At the same time, the Visual Studio extension shows a window saying that Pieces OS is not running. If I click on the launch button, a "route not found" message appears for a moment and then the "Pieces OS is not running" message comes back.

I checked for updates on the Pieces Suite app, but there are no update.

I'm attaching the log file and the response of the http://localhost:1000/applications url. I tried navigating manually to the url opened by the launch button in Visual Studio [(url)](http://localhost:1000/?application=%7B%22name%22%3A%22VISUAL_STUDIO%22%2C%22platform%22%3A%22WINDOWS%22%2C%22privacy%22%3A%22OPEN%22%2C%22capabilities%22%3A%22BLENDED%22%2C%22mechanism%22%3A%22MANUAL%22%2C%22schema%22%3A%7B%22semantic%22%3A%22MAJOR_0_MINOR_0_PATCH_1%22%2C%22migration%22%3A0%7D%2C%22id%22%3A%229ab3c1de-0625-408e-8d42-8e2c48e11d0c%22%2C%22version%22%3A%223.0.0%22%2C%22onboarded%22%3Afalse%2C%22automaticUnload%22%3Afalse%7D&capabilities=1048575&theme=%7B%22darkMode%22%3Atrue%2C%22scaffoldBackgroundColor%22%3A-14737633%2C%22primary%22%3A-328966%2C%22secondary%22%3A-14737633%2C%22onPrimary%22%3A-10724260%2C%22onSecondary%22%3A-328966%2C%22primaryContainer%22%3A-13421773%2C%22surface%22%3A-13750738%2C%22onSurface%22%3A-328966%2C%22error%22%3A-934979%2C%22onError%22%3A-1%7D) and the response is "Route not found".

Thank you in advance.

[log-11252024.txt](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/17903747/log-11252024.txt)
[applications.txt](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/17903752/applications.txt)

## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points Raised:**

* The OS toolbar fails to launch when trying to launch the Visual Studio plugin.
* The issue seems to be related to version 3.0.0 of the Visual Studio plugin.
* The user also experiences issues with the toolbar not launching from other methods, unexpected restarts of Pieces OS, and no response when clicking the system tray icon.

**Problems Identified:**

* Issue with version 3.0.0 of the Visual Studio plugin causing UI thread hang.
* Pieces OS trying to host applets throws an OS error due to missing error code in Dart language sdk.
* Potential problems include lack of IPv6 support, firewall restrictions, account permission or Group policy restrictions.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Hotfix for Visual Studio plugin version 3.0.1 released to resolve UI thread hang.
* Pieces OS version 10.1.15 released with changes to port selection for webview integrations.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue persists despite the released versions.
* Further debugging and gathering of information is needed to identify the root cause.

**Next Steps:**

* User will schedule a time with mark-at-pieces for further debugging.
* A utility will be run to retrieve the OS error code for more information.

**Additional Notes:**

* The conversation highlights the importance of clear communication and collaboration between users and developers.
* The issue seems complex and requires further investigation to resolve.

common_issues.title: Pieces OS and Integrations Crash or Fail to Connect
common_issues.description: Users report Pieces OS crashing or failing to connect, particularly with the "Discover Integrations" feature and Visual Studio extension. Issues involve UI hangs, unresponsive buttons, and error messages. Troubleshooting includes log analysis, version updates (like Visual Studio plugin 3.0.1 and Pieces OS 10.1.15), and debugging connection problems.

related_issues.title: Crash on clicking on "Discover Integrations"
related_issues.text:
Crash on clicking on "Discover Integrations"
### Software

Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Linux

### Your Pieces OS Version

9.0.7

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

When clicking the menu point "Discover Integrations" the pieces os crashes after a few seconds and needs to be restarted.

Menu: ![image](https://github.com/pieces-app/support/assets/7874631/ee50cf5a-c02b-481f-af39-df96bd214437)
System Details: ![image](https://github.com/pieces-app/support/assets/7874631/27dabc03-a33e-4b59-b496-86f532c8a56e)

## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key points raised:**

* User @Idrinth reported crashes in Pieces OS when clicking the "Discover Integrations" button. 
* They provided logs for analysis but no problems were found.
* User @nathan-courtney-pieces confirmed similar crash issues with specific buttons.

**Problems identified:**

* Pieces OS crashes consistently when users click certain integration buttons.
* The specific cause remains unidentified despite analyzing log files.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* No concrete solution has been implemented yet.

**Current status/outcome:**

* The issue is being investigated. @nathan-courtney-pieces will provide an update when a resolution is found.

common_issues.title: Pieces OS Conflicts Causing Functionality Issues
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing conflicts between Pieces OS and other applications, particularly web browsers and extensions, on Windows. This results in errors, crashes, and features not working as expected. Proposed solutions include ensuring compatibility with different application versions, investigating process handling, and addressing potential conflicts with system settings or configurations.

related_issues.title: FireFox not functioning properly under WorkStream Pattern Engine
related_issues.text:
FireFox not functioning properly under WorkStream Pattern Engine
### Software

Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

9.0.7

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Clicking on any link within the Pieces desktop app that required a browser to open up, I would receive the message:
Firefox is already running, but is not responding. The old Firefox process must be closed to open a new window.
![image](https://github.com/pieces-app/support/assets/82057175/706ac8c5-b939-4183-af48-ba573901f6ba)

After further review, it does appear that all instances of firefox are spawned under the Pieces OS service:
![image](https://github.com/pieces-app/support/assets/82057175/716495d0-b4aa-4bfa-b8d4-d0baf32c8984)

I know that disabling the WorkStream Pattern Engine, this is not an issue. (Assuming I kill off all processes of firefox under that task).


It makes me think that since Pieces OS is hijacking the process, and then firefox is trying to spawn the instance outside of that process, there is a conflict.


My default browser is set to firefox.

I'm running W11.
## Key Points of GitHub Issue Conversation:

**Problem:** Pieces for Developers app on Windows 11 attempts to load Firefox URLs as nested processes within the app, causing conflicts.

**Details:**

* Issue reported by TSCarterJr on June 24, 2024.
* Occurs on Windows 11 Home (23H2) with Pieces app version 2.12.5 and OS version 9.0.7.
* Reproduced even after restarts.
* Not related to workstream pattern engine, but likely due to how Pieces app spawns Firefox processes.
* Issue not observed on non-Insider Preview builds.

**Proposed Solutions:**

* Investigate why the issue occurs on Insider Preview builds.

**Current Status:**

* Under investigation by nathan-courtney-pieces.

**Outcome:**

* Awaiting resolution.

common_issues.title: Pieces OS and VS Code Extension Issues
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing various issues with Pieces OS and its VS Code extension, including pasting delays, lack of line-wrapping in code blocks, and problems with screenshot pasting. Proposed solutions include disabling certain features, exploring optimization options, and implementing line wrapping in future releases. Some issues require further investigation and communication with users to understand the specific workflows and problems.

related_issues.title: Pasting in VS Code causes delay
related_issues.text:
Pasting in VS Code causes delay
### Software

VS Code

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

9.0.7

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Sometimes I notice pasting in VS Code causes a delay of around 2-5 seconds. When I disable Pieces it no longer occurs. Specifically, it is pasting anywhere within the code, not necessarily inside the chat assistant. If it happens frequently, I am forced to turn off pieces, otherwise workflow is significantly disrupted.
## GitHub Issue Conversation Summary

**Key Points Raised:**

* Avonbek reported an issue with the Pieces VS Code extension causing a slowdown when pasting text.
* The issue seemed to be related to the `ctrl + v` keybind for the paste command.
* Avonbek suspected the slowdown might be due to performance issues on their machine.

**Problems Identified:**

* The Pieces VS Code extension caused a delay when pasting text using `ctrl + v`.
* The root cause of the slowdown was unclear.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Caleb suggested temporarily removing or rebinding the `ctrl + v` keybind for the paste command.
* Avonbek planned to test the proposed solution and report back.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* Avonbek reported not encountering the slowdown after a work session using the regular VS Code version.
* The issue might have been resolved or could resurface in the future.

**Additional Notes:**

* Avonbek appreciated the developer's responsiveness and willingness to investigate the issue.
* The developer suspected the slowdown might be a performance issue and was exploring optimization options.

related_issues.title: VSCODE Extension, Pieces Copilot line wrapping setting location or settings.json options??
related_issues.text:
VSCODE Extension, Pieces Copilot line wrapping setting location or settings.json options??
### Software

VS Code

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

10.1.10

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

My Pieces Copilot side bar works fine but I haven't been able to find a setting to wrap lines especially in the responses code blocks.
Is there a setting for Pieces extension to wrap all text Markdown and Code Blocks??

See below, markdown text is wrapped but code block text isn't which for myself isn't ideal?
![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/eec00284-7ad3-4895-9969-d66488120d76)

## GitHub Issue Summary

**Key Points:**

* User @johnkennyuk requested the ability to enable line wrapping for code blocks in Pieces OS.
* @caleb-at-pieces confirmed the request and added it to their internal project board.

**Problems Identified:**

* Currently, code blocks in Pieces OS do not have line wrapping enabled, making it difficult to read longer code snippets.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* @caleb-at-pieces plans to implement line wrapping for code blocks in a future release of Pieces OS.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue is currently in the backlog and will be addressed in a future release. 
* No specific timeline has been provided. 
* The user expressed their appreciation for the proposed solution.

related_issues.title: CTRL + V (Super + V) Doesn't work for Screenshots
related_issues.text:
CTRL + V (Super + V) Doesn't work for Screenshots
### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

Latest (downloaded yesterday)

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I tried to take a screenshot and just do CTRL + V (or Super + V ) it didn't work. You can import screenshots from images that you have already saved.
## GitHub Issue Conversation Summary

**Key points raised:**

* User experiencing issues adding images to Pieces desktop app.
* Unsure if issue relates to Saved Materials view or Pieces Copilot input.
* User typically uses macOS screenshot feature (Command + Shift + 5) and Command + V to paste.

**Problems identified:**

* Adding images to Pieces app may be problematic.
* Unclear context of user's workflow and specific issue.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* Clarifying user's workflow and specific issue.
* Offering alternative solutions like video call for further troubleshooting.

**Current status/outcome:**

* Issue not yet resolved. Further investigation and communication needed.

**Additional notes:**

* User willing to participate in further discussion and troubleshooting.
* macOS users typically rely on Command + C/V for copy-pasting.

common_issues.title: Pieces OS: Various Bugs and Feature Requests
common_issues.description: Users report issues with Pieces OS Desktop and VS Code extension, including scrolling problems during Copilot responses, lack of line-wrapping in code blocks, and application crashes. Proposed solutions involve UI/UX improvements, feature additions, and bug fixes. The Pieces team is actively investigating and addressing these issues.

related_issues.title: Pieces Desktop does not scroll when answering
related_issues.text:
Pieces Desktop does not scroll when answering
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

2.12.2

### Early Access Program

- [X] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

When answering, the curser stays with the question, should move to the answer. Requires clicking the arrow-down symbol to the end and then fine-navigating to the begin of the answer.
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation: Scrolling Behavior in Copilot

**Key Points:**

* Scrolling behaviour in Copilot when messages are streaming in needs improvement.
* Users desire to be able to scroll up and down while messages are being generated.
* Current behaviour keeps scrolling to the end of the answer, making it difficult to read the beginning.
* Jump to top/bottom of last answer(s) functionality is also requested.

**Problems Identified:**

* Difficulty in reading the beginning of a message while it is still being generated due to automatic scrolling to the end.
* Inability to scroll up during message generation.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Implement a way to allow users to scroll up and down while messages are being generated.
* Implement a way to jump to the top/bottom of the last answer(s).
* Improve scrolling behaviour to keep the user's scroll position consistent during message generation.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* Improvements have been made in this area.
* Users are encouraged to try the latest version of the software and report any further issues.

**Additional Notes:**

* The desired behaviour for scrolling on answering has been unclear.
* The issue of scrolling on answering needs further investigation.
* Users are encouraged to provide feedback on the improvements and suggest additional features.

related_issues.title: VSCODE Extension, Pieces Copilot line wrapping setting location or settings.json options??
related_issues.text:
VSCODE Extension, Pieces Copilot line wrapping setting location or settings.json options??
### Software

VS Code

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

10.1.10

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

My Pieces Copilot side bar works fine but I haven't been able to find a setting to wrap lines especially in the responses code blocks.
Is there a setting for Pieces extension to wrap all text Markdown and Code Blocks??

See below, markdown text is wrapped but code block text isn't which for myself isn't ideal?
![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/eec00284-7ad3-4895-9969-d66488120d76)

## GitHub Issue Summary

**Key Points:**

* User @johnkennyuk requested the ability to enable line wrapping for code blocks in Pieces OS.
* @caleb-at-pieces confirmed the request and added it to their internal project board.

**Problems Identified:**

* Currently, code blocks in Pieces OS do not have line wrapping enabled, making it difficult to read longer code snippets.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* @caleb-at-pieces plans to implement line wrapping for code blocks in a future release of Pieces OS.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue is currently in the backlog and will be addressed in a future release. 
* No specific timeline has been provided. 
* The user expressed their appreciation for the proposed solution.

## GitHub Issue Summary

**Title:** Application Crashes on Startup

**Author:** rosie-at-pieces

**Date:** 2024-11-14

**Key Points:**

* User Ganesh-2-4 reported the application crashes on startup.

**Problems Identified:**

* The application crashes consistently when launched.
* The root cause of the crash is unknown.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* rosie-at-pieces requested Ganesh-2-4 to send the application logs for troubleshooting.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue is currently being investigated by the Pieces support team.
* No resolution has been provided yet.

**Additional Notes:**

* The issue was reported on November 14, 2024.
* The conversation only includes one message from rosie-at-pieces.

recommendations: **Prioritize Pieces OS and Desktop App Issues:** Allocate additional resources to investigate and resolve the white screen issue, connection problems, and crashes reported by users.  This may involve deeper analysis of logs, system configurations, and potential conflicts with other applications.

**Improve Pieces OS and Integrations Stability:** Focus on addressing crashes and connection failures related to the "Discover Integrations" feature and Visual Studio extension. This includes analyzing UI hangs, unresponsive buttons, and error messages to identify root causes.

**Enhance VS Code Extension Functionality:** Address issues with pasting delays, code block line-wrapping, and screenshot pasting in the VS Code extension. Consider optimization options, feature additions, and clearer communication with users about potential workarounds.

**Gather More Detailed User Feedback:**  When users report issues, encourage them to provide specific details about their operating system, Pieces OS version, and steps to reproduce the problem. This will help in faster diagnosis and resolution.

**Proactive Communication:**  Keep users informed about the status of reported issues, ongoing investigations, and planned fixes or updates. This will enhance transparency and manage user expectations effectively.
